intro: Centaurea atrobanatica, commonly known as the Black-centred Cornflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking dark purple to black central flower head, surrounded by bright blue or purple ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Centaurea atrobanatica is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
